Keywords: Armor , Asgardian , Herald , Mystical , Robot
Real Name: N/A
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Destroy Blocking
GUARDIAN OF ODIN'S TREASURE VAULT: SIDELINE ACTIVE - If The Destroyer is on your Sideline and an opposing character damages a friendly character with an attack, if either character is equipped, after resolutions give The Destroyer a Seeker token and roll a d6 adding the number of Seeker tokens to the result. 6+: Generate The Destroyer from your Sideline in a square along the edge of the map in the same row or column of an equipped character, then remove all Seeker tokens and turn The Destroyer's dial to click X where X is the number of Seeker tokens removed. // If The Destroyer started the game via this trait, when it takes damage after resolutions return it to your Sideline. Protected: Pulse Wave.

Well here's the thing--its *two* equipment sets that are coming out back to back, first Disney+, and then later X of swords. We know disney+'s equipment is nothing super special(granting some useful powers, but aside from the dark hold, the cape, and the serum nothing super gamechanging), but it's still an equipment heavy set with good figures that have that equipment baked in. Meaning he'll be eating pretty good at 50% floor nights.
March 11, 2022
KCSuperman
I don�t think it is an �automatic� have to play this on your sideline. There are a few things to consider before pulling that trigger. First and foremost is: will there be equipment on your team? A lot of the viable equipment (exospex, gems, octopus arms) will be retired this year. We will be getting some equipment in x of swords, but it may not be anything meta or cost effective, it remains to be seen. The second question to consider is: what primes are you sacrificing by choosing this to possibly sit all game on the sideline? There are some very very good primes right now (punisher warmachine, captain mar-velle, gladiator, and gamora). He is still part of your constructed force sideline or not. Third: you have to take damage to possibly bring this guy in. I generally have never been a fan of the hulk strategy of taking damage. It can be a good thing sometimes, but generally I want my figs to stay on click one if I can help it. So it becomes an insurance policy maybe� so go back to consideration 2 above.

February 20, 2022
Redrover454
Dial is impressive, but it's his sideline trait that is truly wild. As popular as equipment is, and with two more equipment sets on the way, if you construct without a Prime on your start force, there's no reason to not use him... For FREE. The best part about his trait is that he returns to the sideline after taking damage, which means he's virtually unscoreable. He's just about worth purposely avoiding a Prime on your force so you can sideline him... For FREE.
